SymbolDef.name: DIS
SymbolDef.descr: Distributed Interactive Simulation (DIS) property, type, and set definitions.

PropertyDef.name: EntityTypeString
PropertyDef.descr: A period delimited string representing the entity's kind, domain, country, category, subcategory, specific, and extra. For example, 1.2.225.1.6.1.0

PropertyDef.name: AppearanceMask
PropertyDef.descr: This hexadecimal value represents the bits that the property value should be written into.

PropertyDef.name: AppearanceType
PropertyDef.descr: The type of appearance to be bound.

PropertyDef.name: Name
PropertyDef.descr: The friendly name of the ArticulatedPartDefinition.

PropertyDef.name: DefinitionGuid
PropertyDef.descr: The DefinitionGUID is used to look up ArticulatedPartDefinition sets. ArticulatedPartDefinition sets will first be looked up based on the object's simulation category ID. If a definition is not found, the DISArticulatedPartDefinitionGuid value in aircraft.cfg or sim.cfg will be used to look up the definition (if present).

PropertyDef.name: PropertyGet
PropertyDef.descr: The property or simulation variable to be used to retrieve the ArticulatedPart value. This property will be used by local DIS entities when a packet is sent.

PropertyDef.name: PropertySet
PropertyDef.descr: The property or simulation variable to be used to apply the ArticulatedPart value. This property will be used by remote DIS entities when a packet is received. If this value is not present, the PropertyGet value will be used instead.

PropertyDef.name: Units
PropertyDef.descr: The units to be used when getting or setting the PropertyGet and PropertySet variables.

PropertyDef.name: CustomClass
PropertyDef.descr: This value will represent the ArticulatedPart class if a Class enumeration value of Custom is selected. This value is required if Custom Class enumeration is selected.

PropertyDef.name: CustomMetric
PropertyDef.descr: This value will represent the ArticulatedPart metric if a Metric enumeration value of Custom is selected. This value is required if Custom Metric enumeration is selected.

PropertyDef.name: Offset
PropertyDef.descr: This value will be added to the ArticulatedPart property value before it is sent or subtracted from the ArticulatedPart value after it is received. This value will be added before the scale value is multiplied if being sent or subtracted after the scale value is divided if being received. The default value is 0.0. If being sent, the formula is: SendValue = (Property + Offset) * Scale. If being received, the formula is: Property = (ReceivedValue / Scale) - Offset.

PropertyDef.name: Scale
PropertyDef.descr: This value will be multiplied against the ArticulatedPart property value before it is sent or divided from the ArticulatedPart value after it is received. This value will be multiplied after the offset value is added if being sent or subtracted after the scale value is divided if being received. The default value is 1.0. If being sent, the formula is: SendValue = (Property + Offset) * Scale. If being received, the formula is: Property = (ReceivedValue / Scale) - Offset.

PropertyDef.name: Class
PropertyDef.descr: The ArticulatedPart class. If a value of Custom is selected, the CustomClass value must also be present.

PropertyDef.name: Metric
PropertyDef.descr: The ArticulatedPart metric. If a value of Custom is selected, the CustomMetric value must also be present.

PropertyDef.name: ExerciseId
PropertyDef.descr: The Exercise ID of the distributed interactive simulation. Applications participating in the same simulation should have matching Exercise IDs. A value of zero may be entered to receive network traffic from all connected exercises. Valid Exercise IDs range from 0 to 255.

PropertyDef.name: SiteId
PropertyDef.descr: The Site ID of this application instance. Site IDs may be the same for multiple applications as long as each application's Application ID is unique. Valid Site IDs range from 0 to 65535.

PropertyDef.name: ApplicationId
PropertyDef.descr: The Application ID of this application instance. Application IDs should be unique for all applications participating in a given exercise from a given site. For example, the Application ID should be unique for all simulations sharing the same Exercise ID and Site ID. Valid Application IDs range from 0 to 65535.

PropertyDef.name: EntityId
PropertyDef.descr: The Entity ID of the user entity. Valid Entity IDs range from 0 to 65535.

PropertyDef.name: ForceId
PropertyDef.descr: The Force ID of the user entity. Valid Force IDs range from 0 to 255.

PropertyDef.name: Marking
PropertyDef.descr: The Marking of the user entity. The Marking must be 11 characters or less.

PropertyDef.name: Heartbeat
PropertyDef.descr: The maximum time in seconds that an entity will wait between heartbeats. Simulation objects will automatically heartbeat when their current location or dead reckoning values exceed that of the DIS standard. The default value is 5 seconds.

PropertyDef.name: MaxHeartbeatFrequency
PropertyDef.descr: The maximum frequency that an entity will heartbeat in Hertz. For example, a value of 60 Hz means that an entity will heartbeat no more than 60 times per second. The default value is 60 Hz.

PropertyDef.name: Timeout
PropertyDef.descr: The timeout value to remove non-heartbeating entities in seconds. The default value is 10 seconds.

PropertyDef.name: RelativeTimestamp
PropertyDef.descr: Set to true if relative timestamps should be used, false for absolute timestamps.

PropertyDef.name: ConnectionType
PropertyDef.descr: The desired connection type, either Multicast or Broadcast. Multicast connection types must provide a valid Multicast Address. Broadcast connection types must provide a valid Subnet Mask. The default connection type is Multicast.

PropertyDef.name: IpAddress
PropertyDef.descr: The local IP Address of this machine. The local IP Address is used in conjunction with the subnet mask to create the broadcast address when using the broadcast connection type. The local IP Address is also used to filter incoming packets that may have been sent from this machine.

PropertyDef.name: MulticastAddress
PropertyDef.descr: The Multicast Address is only used by the Multicast connection type. The valid Multicast Address range is 224.0.0.1 to 239.255.255.255.

PropertyDef.name: SubnetMask
PropertyDef.descr: The Subnet Mask to be used in conjunction with the machine's IP Address to create the final broadcast address. The default value of the Subnet Mask is 255.255.255.0 (class C network). The Subnet Mask should be within the range 0.0.0.0 to 255.255.255.254. For universal broadcast mode, a Subnet Mask of 0.0.0.0 should be entered. This value is only valid for Broadcast connection types.

PropertyDef.name: Port
PropertyDef.descr: The Port used by both Multicast and Broadcast connection types. Valid Port ranges are from 1024 to 65535. The default value is 3000.

PropertyDef.name: TimeToLive
PropertyDef.descr: The packet Time to Live value. This value represents the number of routers that a packet is allowed to cross. The default value is 64 and the maximum value is 255.

PropertyDef.name: ExerciseRegionTopLeft
PropertyDef.descr: The latitude and longitude of the top-left corner of the exercise region in degrees. Remote entities reporting outside of the exercise region will not be processed. To disable the exercise region, a value of zero should be entered for the latitude and longitude of both the top-left and bottom-right corners.

PropertyDef.name: ExerciseRegionBottomRight
PropertyDef.descr: The latitude and longitude of the bottom-right corner of the exercise region in degrees. Remote entities reporting outside of the exercise region will not be processed. To disable the exercise region, a value of zero should be entered for the latitude and longitude of both the top-left and bottom-right corners.

PropertyDef.name: EnableLogging
PropertyDef.descr: Set to true enable logging.

PropertyDef.name: BroadcastAITraffic
PropertyDef.descr: Set to true to enable the broadcasting of AI traffic as DIS entities.

PropertyDef.name: BroadcastNavAids
PropertyDef.descr: Set to true to enable the broadcasting of navigation aids such as VOR, DME, TACAN, and NDB.

PropertyDef.name: DisableArticulatedParts
PropertyDef.descr: Set to true to disable the serialization and deserialization of articulated parts.

PropertyDef.name: DisableEntityAppearance
PropertyDef.descr: Set to true to disable the serialization and deserialization of entity appearances.

PropertyDef.name: DisableDeadReckoning
PropertyDef.descr: Set to true to disable the dead reckoning of remote entities.

PropertyDef.name: PullToGround
PropertyDef.descr: Set to true to ground based platforms and lifeforms onto the terrain and surface based platforms onto the water.

PropertyDef.name: AutoFindIPAddress
PropertyDef.descr: Set to true to Automatically fill in the IPAddress with the local machine's address

PropertyDef.name: IntercomChannel
PropertyDef.descr: The channel number (frequency) of the intercom. Valid values range from 1 to 100,000. Only intercom transmissions on the same channel will be heard.

PropertyDef.name: IntercomPriority
PropertyDef.descr: The priority associated with the intercom transmission. A value of 0 represents exempt meaning the transmission will always be heard. Valid values are within the range 1 to 255 with 1 being the highest priority and 255 being the lower priority. Intercoms with higher priorities will be heard over intercoms with lower priorities when transmitting at the same time. The intercom with the lower priority in this case will be muted.

PropertyDef.name: EmissionName
PropertyDef.descr: Text based friendly name of the emission.

PropertyDef.name: EmissionSystemName
PropertyDef.descr: Text based friendly name of the emission system.

PropertyDef.name: EmitterName
PropertyDef.descr: An integer value representing the emitter name.

PropertyDef.name: EmitterFunction
PropertyDef.descr: An integer value representing the emitter function.

PropertyDef.name: EmitterNumber
PropertyDef.descr: The unique emitter identification number for a specific emitter. Valid values are within the range 1 to 254 inclusively.

PropertyDef.name: EmitterBeamName
PropertyDef.descr: Text based friendly name for the emitter beam.

PropertyDef.name: BeamNumber
PropertyDef.descr: The unique beam identification number for a specific beam. Valid values are within the range 1 to 254 inclusively.

PropertyDef.name: BeamParameter
PropertyDef.descr: The beam parameter used in conjunction with the emitter name for database look-ups.

PropertyDef.name: Frequency
PropertyDef.descr: The average center frequency of the beam emission in Hertz.

PropertyDef.name: FrequencyRange
PropertyDef.descr: The difference between the upper and lower limits of the center frequency.

PropertyDef.name: EffectiveRadiatedPower
PropertyDef.descr: The average effective radiated power for the emission in dBm.

PropertyDef.name: PulseRepetitionFrequency
PropertyDef.descr: The average pulse repetition frequency of the emission in Hertz.

PropertyDef.name: PulseWidth
PropertyDef.descr: The average pulse with of the emission in micro-seconds.

PropertyDef.name: AzimuthCenter
PropertyDef.descr: The center azimuth of the beam in degrees relative to the emitter.

PropertyDef.name: AzimuthSweep
PropertyDef.descr: The half-angle sweep of the azimuth in degrees relative to the center azimuth.

PropertyDef.name: ElevationCenter
PropertyDef.descr: The center elevation of the beam in degrees relative to the emitter.

PropertyDef.name: ElevationSweep
PropertyDef.descr: The half-angle sweep of the elevation in degrees relative to the center elevation.

PropertyDef.name: SweepSync
PropertyDef.descr: The semi-open range from 0.0 to 100.0 representing the percentage of the pattern scanned from its origin.

PropertyDef.name: BeamFunction
PropertyDef.descr: An integer value representing the beam function.

PropertyDef.name: IsHighDensityTrack
PropertyDef.descr: True if all targets in the scan pattern are to be considered tracked or jammed.

PropertyDef.name: JammingMode
PropertyDef.descr: The jamming mode sequence for the given emitter in string representation. For example, 1.2.3.4

PropertyDef.name: MunitionEffectTimeOut
PropertyDef.descr: The time in seconds before infinite lifetime munition effects will be removed from the simulation. A value of 0 can be used to prevent munition effects from timing out.

PropertyDef.name: MunitionName
PropertyDef.descr: Text based friendly name of the munition.

PropertyDef.name: DetonationName
PropertyDef.descr: Text based friendly name of the detonation.

PropertyDef.name: EffectName
PropertyDef.descr: The file name of the particle effect (without the extension).

PropertyDef.name: DetonationResult
PropertyDef.descr: The detonation result type of the munition. Multiple detonation result types can be associated with a single detonation definition.

EnumVal.name: KILL_WITH_FRAGMENT_TYPE_1_AFTER_FLY_OUT_FAILURE
EnumVal.xml_name: Kill with Fragment Type 1 after Fly out Failure

EnumVal.name: KILL_WITH_FRAGMENT_TYPE_2_AFTER_FLY_OUT_FAILURE
EnumVal.xml_name: Kill with Fragment Type 2 after Fly out Failure

EnumVal.name: MISS_DUE_TO_FLY_OUT_FAILURE
EnumVal.xml_name: Miss Due to Fly out Failure

EnumVal.name: MISS_DUE_TO_END_GAME_FAILURE
EnumVal.xml_name: Miss Due to End Game Failure

EnumVal.name: MISS_DUE_TO_FLY_OUT_AND_END_GAME_FAILURE
EnumVal.xml_name: Miss Due to Fly out and End Game Failure

SetDef.name: EntityType
SetDef.descr: This set pairs an EntityTypeString with a ContainerTitle for entity substitution and broadcasting.

SetDef.name: EntityTypes
SetDef.descr: The parent set of all EntityType inner sets.

SetDef.name: Appearance
SetDef.descr: This set represents a single appearance.

SetDef.name: EntityAppearanceDefinition
SetDef.descr: This set represents a single EntityAppearanceDefinition.

SetDef.name: EntityAppearanceDefinitions
SetDef.descr: This set represents a list of EntityAppearanceDefinitions.

SetDef.name: ArticulatedPart
SetDef.descr: This set represents a single ArticulatedPart instance.

SetDef.name: ArticulatedPartDefinition
SetDef.descr: This set represents an ArticulatedPartDefinition which consists of a Name, DefinitionGuid, and a list of ArticulatedPart sets.

SetDef.name: ArticulatedPartDefinitions
SetDef.descr: This set represents a list of ArticulatedPartDefinition sets.

SetDef.name: Configuration
SetDef.descr: The root configuration set provides access to all other inner configuration sets.

SetDef.name: Entity
SetDef.descr: This set provides exercise, site, application, and entity based configurations.

SetDef.name: Connection
SetDef.desc: This set provides connection based configuration such as connection type.

SetDef.name: Timing
SetDef.descr: This set provides timing based configuration such entity heartbeat and timeout durations.

SetDef.name: Options
SetDef.descr: This set provides general option configuration.

SetDef.name: Radios
SetDef.descr: This set provides radio and intercom based configuration. Users can broadcast communication on their current COM frequency using the CapsLock key. Users can broadcast to all entities on the selected intercom channel by using Shift+CapsLock.

SetDef.name: Emissions
SetDef.descr: This set provides electromagnetic emission based configuration.

SetDef.name: ElectromagneticEmission
SetDef.descr: This set represents an electromagnetic emission definition for a given EntityType which is composed of one or more ElectromagneticEmissionSystem.

SetDef.name: ElectromagneticEmissionSystem
SetDef.descr: This set represents a single electromagnetic emission system which is composed of one or more EmitterBeam.

SetDef.name: EmitterBeam
SetDef.descr: This set represents a single emitter beam.

SetDef.name: Munitions
SetDef.descr: This set can be used to configure information about munition based types such as fire and detonation particle effects.

SetDef.name: MunitionDefinition
SetDef.descr: A MunitionDefinition is used to configure settings for a given munition type (i.e. particle effects).

SetDef.name: FireEffectList
SetDef.descr: The FireEffectList is used to configure the list of particle effects to be created at the time this munition type is fired.

SetDef.name: DefaultDetonationEffectList
SetDef.descr: The DefaultDetonationEffectList is used to configure the default list of particle effects to be created for all detonation result types. The DefaultDetonationEffectList does not override a detonation type of NONE. The DefaultDetonationEffectList can be overridden by creating additional DetonationDefinitions.

SetDef.name: DetonationEffects
SetDef.descr: The DetonationEffects section is used configure how particle effects should be created at the time this munition type is detonated.

SetDef.name: DetonationDefinition
SetDef.descr: The DetonationDefinition entry is used to bind a list of particle effects to a list of detonation results. Multiple particle effects can be bound to multiple detonation results using a single DetonationDefinition. For example, one could bind a list of water based particle effects to a list of water based detonation results.

SetDef.name: DetonationResults
SetDef.descr: The DetonationResults list is used to configure the list of detonation results associated with this DetonationDefinition.

SetDef.name: DetonationEffectList
SetDef.descr: The DetonationEffectList is used to configure the list of particle effects to be created with this DetonationDefinition.
